intro: Cinchona afroinda, commonly known as the African quinine tree, is a species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that contain the alkaloid quinine, historically used for treating malaria. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has attracted attention for potential pharmaceutical applications.
